item.title: Ticket #3501 (add_submenu_page not working with post.php) created
item.dc:creator: tsalagi_red
item.description: I am working on a reviews plugin, and add_submenu_page function does not seem to work with post.php. If I change to edit.php or options.php it works fine. I am using the latest nightly build 2.1 alpha 3.

How about a "Deactivate Plugins" plugin that, when activated, deactivates all plugins (including itself) ?

item.title: Ticket #3488 (Support for different calendars) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: 2.1 (and WPMU, WPCOM) allow translations to provide a locale.php file (ar.php for example). Currently it is used only to specify the text direction. However, we could make it more powerful by loading it at the same time as plugins are loaded. All locale specific code could be put in locale.php.

item.title: Ticket #3500 (Akismet Admin Panel Excerpts) created
item.dc:creator: sunburntkamel
item.description: The akismet spam admin page is often too long to be reviewed. If spam comments were displayed as excerpts up to 200 characters, it would cut down on the amount of scrolling without reducing the ability to determine false positives.

item.title: Ticket #3499 (Create attachments for XML-RPC media uploads) updated
item.dc:creator: ruckus
item.description: The attached patch is against 2.0.6-RC1 (svn rev. 4663)

item.title: xmlrpc-attachment.diff attached to Ticket #3499
item.dc:creator: ruckus

item.title: Ticket #3499 (Create attachments for XML-RPC media uploads) created
item.dc:creator: ruckus
item.description: When uploading files via XML-RPC, attachment records are not created. This patch fixes the bug by backporting the required functionality from trunk (2.1-alpha3).

item.title: Ticket #3498 (Deactivate All on plugins admin page) updated
item.dc:creator: JeremyVisser
item.description:
(Offtopic) Is that the same error you reported on the WP-SlimStat website? To fix it, you need to work around a bug in the plugin by changing the WPLANG value in wp-config.php from blank to 'en'.

When I am bulk deactivating plugins, I simply use the middle-mouse button and close all the tabs that I have opened after they have finished loading. I find that is quite fast enough for my needs.

item.title: Ticket #3498 (Deactivate All on plugins admin page) created
item.dc:creator: shorty114
item.description: It would be handy to have a "Deactivate All" button on the WordPress Plugins admin page. I just had to go through and deactivate each and every one by hand to debug an error, and it wasn't fun.
